title: Modern Learning Theory-Based Course for Social Collaboration in Mathematics Problem-Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic operations and problem-solving experience
context.additional_context: Asynchronous math curriculum emphasizing socially collaborative learning in smartphone-based LMS environments, aiming to enhance foundational numeracy skills for professionals.

learning_goals: Learners can plan and execute online collaborative activities with peers to solve complex mathematical problems.
Learners acquire mathematical thinking applicable to real work situations through activity theory-based tasks.
Learners form social networks and build knowledge-sharing systems using LMS collaborative tools.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
